intro: Perezia wislizeni var. typica, commonly known as the desert perezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths.
